column1: #text=I began by finding the culprit of my flat tire , it was a nail on the side of the road .
#text=Unfortunately I did not have a spare tire so I had to carry my bike the rest of the way home .
#text=After the gruesome trek back to my house I flipped the bicycle upside down and began my repair .
#text=First I took off the outer tire to replace my tube with a better more expensive tube that has the ability to fix a puncture .
#text=I do not want to experience carrying my bike a mile ever again .
#text=After putting the new tube on I screw back on the tire and put the outer tire over the tube .
#text=I then fill the PSI to 170 in my tire and listen for any leaking air .
#text=Then I spin the tire to make all the slime inside become evenly distributed throughout .
#text=This will prevent leaks in the future and even with a slight leak I will still be able to ride back home and fix the tire quickly yet again .
